required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PALS for Pap Smear Follow up
clinical_study.official_title: Utilization Of A Web-Based Platform (Patient Activated Learning System- PALS) To Improve Knowledge And Follow-Up Among Women With Abnormal Cervical Cancer Screening (PALS)

lead_sponsor.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

clinical_study.source: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the researchers will utilize information gained from patient interviews about their knowledge of the cervical cancer screening and treatment process, and perceived barriers surrounding appropriate follow up, to create content for the intervention.

detailed_description.textblock: The overall goal of this research is to develop and test an intervention designed to improve knowledge and follow up among underserved women with abnormal pap smears. The researchers will use a unique web-based platform, the Patient Activated Learning System (PALS), which provides engaging and informative video and text designed to improve patient knowledge specifically among underserved populations. Twenty diverse patients with abnormal pap smears will be recruited from the Women's Health colposcopy clinic for initial qualitative interviews. Forty patients from the same population will then be engaged in a pre-post pilot to examine feasibility, acceptability, and impact of modules on improving knowledge.

primary_outcome.description: Knowledge of cervical cancer screening and treatment, and perceived barriers, as measured in qualitative interviews
Quantitative change in knowledge post-intervention, as measured by attendance rates at follow-up visits

arm_group.description: This arm will influence the development of a patient-directed education module using the Patient Activated Learning System (PALS)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All Women 21-65 years with diagnosis of abnormal pap smear presenting to Women's Health Colposcopy Clinic at WCMC
- Access to a smartphone
- English or Spanish Speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Non-English or Spanish speakers

overall_official.affiliation: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

facility.name: New York Prebyterian Hospital Weill Cornell
